title: Colombia, ELN rebels conclude first round of ‘successful’ talks
description: While no ceasefire was reached, two sides agree to provide 'emergency care' in violence-hit regions starting next month.

title: US announces sanctions against son of Zimbabwean president
description: The US Treasury Department has accused Emmerson Mnangagwa Jr of ties to sanctioned businessman Kudakwashe Tagwirei.

title: CVS, Walgreens finalise $10bn in deals to settle opioid lawsuits
description: The deals are among the largest in a wave of proposed and finalised settlements over opioids in recent years.

title: Asylum seeker crossings into US city of El Paso spike on weekend
description: Critics warn looming end of Title 42 immigration policy could lead to more crossings along the US-Mexico border.

title: Photos: Mexico’s Guadalupe pilgrimage draws millions of devotees
description: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is the second-most-visited Catholic shrine in the world after St Peter's.

title: G7 pledges to meet Ukraine’s ‘urgent’ air defence requirements
description: Zelenskyy also appeals to G7 for tanks, artillery and long-range weapons as Russia maintains barrage of attacks.

title: Oath Keepers plotted to use force on January 6: US prosecutor
description: Prosecutor tells US jury that far-right group members plotted to stop transfer of power and keep Donald Trump in office.

title: China launches suit against US at WTO over chip curbs: Report
description: In October the US published a sweeping set of export controls aimed at kneecapping China's semiconductor sector.

title: EU sanctions Iran over protest crackdown and Russia drone sales
description: Russia stands accused of sending Iranian-made drones over Ukraine to strike at power plants, other key infrastructure.

title: Argentina fans party in Qatar ahead of World Cup semifinal
description: Fans gathered at Doha's Corniche in support of Argentina's football team ahead of the semifinal.

title: All eyes on Messi as Argentina train ahead of Croatia clash
description: Messi set to become joint record appearance-maker in World Cup history when Argentina take on Croatia in the semifinal.

title: Photos: NASA’s Orion capsule visits Moon, returns to Earth
description: The splashdown ends a 25-day mission less than a week after the capsule passed about 127km above the Moon.

title: What is behind the violence between Serbia and Kosovo?
description: Tensions rise in the Balkans with attacks on police, mass police resignations and delayed elections.

title: US city removes last public Confederate statue
description: Mayor of Richmond, Virginia, ordered Confederate symbols removed amid 2020 racial justice protests across US.

title: EU could face gas shortage next year, IEA warns
description: The EU may avoid an energy crisis this year but needs to take action to prevent a shortage next year, IEA and EU say.

title: Frank Soo: English football’s history-maker
description: When footballer Frank Soo stepped out at Ninian Park in 1942, he became the first non-white player to represent England.

title: Nigerian government rejects report on military abortion programme
description: Nigeria's government denounced a Reuters report of clandestine abortion scheme as a 'body of insults' against Nigerians.

title: Putin cancels annual year-end news conference: Kremlin
description: Break in tradition comes as Russia's war in Ukraine falters and its economy struggles under the weight of sanctions.

title: Croatia ‘can hurt’ Argentina in semifinal, warns coach Scaloni
description: Ahead of Tuesday's match, Scaloni and his team reveal cautious optimism.

title: El Salvador crackdown could prompt gangs to ‘adapt and reshuffle’
description: The government’s eight-month state of exception has seen civil liberties suspended and tens of thousands imprisoned.

title: Can history-makers Morocco win the World Cup?
description: Fairytale run to the semi-finals has seen the Atlas Lions create footballing history but now France await.

title: ‘Hurting people’: The ‘cover-up teams’ operating on the US border
description: When Border Patrol pursuits of migrant vehicles have led to accidents, an opaque unit has been among those responding.

title: Hard bargains, no lectures: What Africa needs at Biden’s summit
description: The US knows what it wants from Africa — it is not democracy. Does Africa know what it wants from the US?

title: Chad releases 139 detainees from protest crackdown in October
description: The move comes a week after more than 260 people were handed jail terms of between two to three years.

title: Macron postpones France’s pension overhaul denounced by unions
description: The French president delays the announcement of his divisive pension reform plans from this week to January.

title: Maria Telkes: Why Google honours her today
description: Telkes was an innovative scientist recognised for her contributions to the solar energy technologies.

title: Guinea ex-dictator Camara denies 2009 massacre role in court
description: The former Guinean strongman is being charged alongside 10 other officials for their roles in the gruesome massacre.

title: LGBTQ communities in the US face ‘rising threat of violence’
description: As attacks mount, advocates say the government must do more to combat hate speech and gun crimes.

title: Deadly attack on Kabul hotel popular with Chinese nationals
description: At least three attackers killed by security forces after they open fire at the hotel in central Kabul, says an official.

title: Heavy snow disrupts UK travel after this year’s coldest night
description: Two coal plants are on standby while heavy snowfall blankets parts of the UK, disrupting transportation.

title: Why does India still use and trade asbestos?
description: Russia is among the nations that supply India with asbestos, a substance banned in several countries.

title: England beat hosts Pakistan to clinch cricket Test series
description: England snatch a 26-run victory against Pakistan in the second Test in Multan to take an unbeatable 2-0 lead.

title: Iran blacklists more EU, UK officials in tit-for-tat move
description: Tehran’s new sanctions deal with the assassination of Iran’s top general Qassem Soleimani by the US.

title: Analysis: Countdown to perdition for SA’s Ramaphosa or 2nd term?
description: President Ramaphosa could survive an impeachment vote this week but seeking re-election could be harder.

title: Released Russian arms dealer Bout joins ultranationalist party
description: Viktor Bout was freed last week from a 25-year US prison sentence in swap for basketball star Brittney Griner.

title: The disabled freestyle footballer wowing World Cup fans
description: Juanro Aguiló was born with only one, incomplete arm. Today he is an ace freestyle footballer and motivational speaker.

title: Four people charged in EU parliament corruption investigation
description: Qatar, the Gulf state that is alleged to be behind the scandal, rejects any attempts to associate it with the misconduct

title: Ukraine says it killed Wagner mercenaries, who are they?
description: Controversial armed group emerged from being a murky guns-for-hire enterprise to a public extension of the Russian army.

title: Forced to eat leaves: Hungry and besieged in Burkina Faso
description: In the northern town of Djibo, 370,000 people are trapped by a continuing blockade - largely cut off from food and aid.

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian girl in occupied West Bank raid
description: Jana Majdi Zakarneh, 16, was shot dead while standing on the roof of her home during an Israeli military raid on Jenin.

title: Iran publicly carries out second protest-related execution
description: Iran has signalled more executions could be carried out amid condemnation by rights groups.

title: Can Ronaldo rediscover his purpose after World Cup exit?
description: At 37, he's not scoring as much as he used to. Can being on the bench bring out the best of what he can offer now?

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 292
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 292nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Bali governor insists sex ban no risk to tourists
description: Bali Governor Wayan Koster says authorities will not check marital status of those checking in at tourist accommodation.

title: Morocco coach says his team is the ‘Rocky of this World Cup’
description: 'I think now the world is with Morocco,' coach Walid Regragui said, comparing the team's run to the iconic boxing movie.

title: Germany is targeting post-colonial thinkers for a reason
description: Postcolonialism is threatening the German state’s perception of its national identity and that of Israel.

title: Russia’s Wagner mercenaries target in hotel attack, governor says
description: Ukrainian governor Serhiy Haidai claimed a 'huge number' died in a strike on hotel where Russian mercenaries were based.

title: England’s Harry Kane ‘gutted’ by penalty miss against France
description: “There’s no hiding from it, it hurts,” England’s captain said on social media about his World Cup penalty miss.

title: Taiwan asks state banks to ‘appropriately handle’ China exposure
description: Finance Minister Su Jain-rong makes remarks in response to question about risks of investing in China.

title: Zelenskyy renews diplomacy, thanks US for ‘unprecedented’ help
description: Ukrainian president holds talks with US, French and Turkish presidents amid fierce, protracted battles on eastern front.

title: Two killed in Peru as protests over Castillo’s arrest spread
description: Two teenagers killed in Andahuaylas, where protesters tried to storm the city's airport, say authorities.

title: Australia’s Albanese to meet gas lobby over price cap concerns
description: Australian leader is aiming to pass legislation this week imposing caps on wholesale gas and coal prices.

title: Portugal’s Ronaldo says his World Cup dream has ‘ended’
description: 'The dream was beautiful as long as it lasted,' Cristiano Ronaldo wrote on Instagram in a possible hint at retirement.

title: New ‘dream’ ball introduced for World Cup’s final matches
description: The Al Hilm — 'the dream' in Arabic — will be used in the semifinals, third-place playoff, and final.

title: After Brazil, tough contenders Croatia aim to end Messi’s dream
description: Fresh from Brazil victory, the Croatia side is confident as they prepare for World Cup semifinal against Argentina.
